DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging And/Or MRI-Based Angiogram Image Study Brain Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not magnetic resonance imaging and/or MRI-based angiogram imaging of the brain was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging And/Or MRI-Based Angiogram Image Study Brain Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._An image of blood vessels constructed using magnetic resonance imaging._A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose._An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging And/Or MRI-Based Angiogram Image Study
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:An image of blood vessels constructed using magnetic resonance imaging.:A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
An image of blood vessels constructed using magnetic resonance imaging.
A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
